medical_history.chief_complaint: Postnatal growth failure associated with normal elevated serum concentrations of growth hormone (GH) and low serum levels of insulin-like growth factor (IGF-I).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 first presented at 5 years of age with a height of 90.3 cm and a body weight of 12.6 kg. Patient 2 was born normal at 38 weeks but showed growth issues by 1.8 years, with a height of 71.8 cm.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both patients have elevated GH levels, low-normal levels of GH-binding protein, and low IGF-I and IGFBP-3 levels. Patient 1 showed no response to growth hormone therapy but modest response to IGF-I therapy. Patient 2 exhibited similar biochemical abnormalities.
medical_history.family_history: Both patients are from a non-consanguineous family with two heterozygous GHR mutations, confirming inherited GHR mutations from both parents.
